body_html:
I just have a look at https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_shared_lib.cmake

this file seems use a very tricky way to generate dll using cmake.

If you directly follow the instruction in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/README.md

The tensorflow_BUILD_SHARED_LIB option is default to be off, I am testing on building shared lib with this option on. cmake gui is recommended under windows enviornment to correctly set the dependencies.

Also this cmake file can generate TensorflowConfig.cmake after INSTALL build, location will be $INSTALL_DIR/lib/cmake, not sure if everything is alright, but worth a test

Also this cmake file can generate TensorflowConfig.cmake after INSTALL build, location will be $INSTALL_DIR/lib/cmake, not sure if everything is alright, but worth a test
body:
I just have a look at https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_shared_lib.cmake

this file seems use a very tricky way to generate dll using cmake.

If you directly follow the instruction in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/README.md

The tensorflow_BUILD_SHARED_LIB option is default to be off, I am testing on building shared lib with this option on. cmake gui is recommended under windows enviornment to correctly set the dependencies.

Also this cmake file can generate TensorflowConfig.cmake after INSTALL build, location will be $INSTALL_DIR/lib/cmake, not sure if everything is alright, but worth a test
